source.description: Split 1 well from a 6 well plate into 3 wells in a 6 well plate.

source.body: Cells should be passaged as single cells prior to nucleofection. Split cells into 3 wells of a 6 well plate 48 hours prior to nucleofection (plan for cells to be confluent in 48 hours). You will need 3 million cells per nucleofection, so 3-6 confluent wells should be sufficient

source.body: Individual donor cell lines exhibit variable sensitivity to accutase-mediated dissociation. Thus, monitor cells closely to determine when single cell dissociation is achieved.

Coat plate for nucleofection (2-3 wells) with matrigel supplemented with RGD for
Just prior to splitting cells for nucleofection, equilibrate Matrigel/RGD coated plate with 3-5 mL/well DMEM/F12+10% FBS supplemented with 10 uM Rock Inhibitor.

source.description: Collect cells in 5 mL PBS and transfer to a 15 mL conical tube.

Spin at 750-800 rpm for
.

Resuspend cell pellet in
PBS in 15 mL conical tube.

Pipette
into cell counter.
Using all four corners of the countess slide, calculate the average number of cells.
Multiply the average by 10,000 (104).

Multiply product from step 24 by 3 to get the total number of cells.
_________ average number of cells x 10,000 x 3 = total number of cells.
Take total number of cells calculated in step 25 and divide by 3 million.
Take answer from previous step and divide by 3 to get the volume of cells necessary for nucleofection.
Transfer the desired volume of cells to microcentrifuge tube.

Centrifuge cells at 90 xg for
.
Aspirate PBS.

source.body: If performing multiple nucleofections, make a master mix.

Combine Reaction Mix from step 31 (
) with previously aliquoted DNA from
Mix Reaction Mix and DNA with cell pellet by pipetting up and down with p200 pipette.

source.body: Try to pipette as little as possible. Pipette only until mixed.

source.description:
Transfer
to a cuvette.
Nucleofect with Lonza program CA-137 in P3 solution.
Add a small amount of media to cuvette via dropper in order to obtain all the cells form the cuvette.
Transfer cells/DNA solution to appropriate pre-coated well containing 2 mL of DMEM/F12+10% FBS+10 uM Rock Inhibitor.

Incubate at
overnight.

Continue cultruing the iPSC in 1 well of a 6 well plate for 5-7 days post nucleofection, changing mTesR1 daily.
a.
post nucleofection--add mTesR1 with 5 uM Rock Inhibitor.
b.
post nucleofection-- add mTesR1 with 2.5 uM Rock Inhibitor.
c.
post nucleofection-- add mTesR1 with 1uM Rock Inhibitor.

source.body: 24 hours after nucleofection, cells exhibit extended processes - this is expected. Over the following 24-72 hours, cells recover and return to typical rounded iPSC morphology. The exact timeline for the morphological recovery is dependent on donor lines.

source.description: Continue cultruing in mTesR1 until confluent.

source.body: Cells must be maintained for 5 days post-nucleofection prior to screening to minimize chimeric clones.
